arroyo-village.defaultAnnouncement: Welcome to Arroyo Village! We're here to help you find the resources you need to thrive in our community. Click on the buttons below to learn more about the resources available to you.

resources.heading: RESOURCES
resources.subheading: Find the resources you need to thrive in your community.

catholicCharities.name: Catholic Charities
catholicCharities.description: Catholic Charities provides emergency housing services to individuals and families in need.

coloradoCoalitionForTheHomeless.name: Colorado Coalition for the Homeless
coloradoCoalitionForTheHomeless.description: The Colorado Coalition for the Homeless provides emergency housing services to individuals and families in need.

jewishFamilyService.name: Jewish Family Service
jewishFamilyService.description: Jewish Family Service provides emergency housing services to individuals and families in need.

lawrenceStreetCommunityCenter.description: The Lawrence Street Community Center provides emergency housing services to individuals and families in need.

newLifeProgram.description: The New Life Program provides emergency housing services to individuals and families in need.

theDeloresProject.name: The Delores Project
theDeloresProject.description: The Delores Project provides emergency housing services to individuals and families in need.

theDenverRescueMission.name: The Denver Rescue Mission
theDenverRescueMission.description: The Denver Rescue Mission provides emergency housing services to individuals and families in need.

theDenverSamaritanHouse.name: The Denver Samaritan House
theDenverSamaritanHouse.description: The Denver Samaritan House provides emergency housing services to individuals and families in need.

theHOPEProgram.name: The HOPE Program
theHOPEProgram.description: The HOPE Program provides emergency housing services to individuals and families in need.

emergencyRentalAssistanceProgram.name: Emergency Rental Assistance Program
emergencyRentalAssistanceProgram.description: The Emergency Rental Assistance Program provides financial assistance to individuals and families who are unable to pay their rent due to the COVID-19 pandemic.

temporaryRentalAndUtilityAssistance.name: Temporary Rental and Utility Assistance
temporaryRentalAndUtilityAssistance.description: The Temporary Rental and Utility Assistance program provides financial assistance to individuals and families who are unable to pay their rent and utilities.

denverHousingAuthority.name: Denver Housing Authority
denverHousingAuthority.description: The Denver Housing Authority provides financial assistance to individuals and families who are unable to pay their rent.

denverHumanServices.name: Denver Human Services
denverHumanServices.description: Denver Human Services provides financial assistance to individuals and families who are unable to pay their rent.

villageResourceCenter.name: Village Resource Center
villageResourceCenter.description: The Village Resource Center provides financial assistance to individuals and families who are unable to pay their rent.

coloradoLowIncomeEnergyAssistanceProgram.name: Colorado Low-Income Energy Assistance Program
coloradoLowIncomeEnergyAssistanceProgram.description: The Colorado Low-Income Energy Assistance Program provides financial assistance to individuals and families who are unable to pay their utility bills.

energyBillAssistanceProgram.name: Energy Bill Assistance Program
energyBillAssistanceProgram.description: The Energy Bill Assistance Program provides financial assistance to individuals and families who are unable to pay their utility bills.

energyOutreachColorado.name: Energy Outreach Colorado
energyOutreachColorado.description: Energy Outreach Colorado provides financial assistance to individuals and families who are unable to pay their utility bills.

centerForWorkEducationAndEmployment.name: Center for Work Education and Employment
centerForWorkEducationAndEmployment.description: The Center for Work Education and Employment provides employment resources to individuals and families in need.

coloradoWorkforceCenter.name: Colorado Workforce Center
coloradoWorkforceCenter.description: The Colorado Workforce Center provides employment resources to individuals and families in need.

employmentAssistance.name: Employment Assistance
employmentAssistance.description: Employment Assistance provides employment resources to individuals and families in need.

employmentSolutions.name: Employment Solutions
employmentSolutions.description: Employment Solutions provides employment resources to individuals and families in need.

primeSourceStaffing.name: Prime Source Staffing
primeSourceStaffing.description: Prime Source Staffing provides employment resources to individuals and families in need.

bienvenidosFoodBank.name: Bienvenidos Food Bank
bienvenidosFoodBank.description: The Bienvenidos Food Bank provides food resources to individuals and families in need.

communityTable.name: Community Table
communityTable.description: The Community Table provides food resources to individuals and families in need.

coloradoFoodPantries.name: Colorado Food Pantries
coloradoFoodPantries.description: Colorado Food Pantries provides food resources to individuals and families in need.

foodBankOfTheRockies.name: Food Bank of the Rockies
foodBankOfTheRockies.description: The Food Bank of the Rockies provides food resources to individuals and families in need.

hungerFreeColorado.name: Hunger Free Colorado
hungerFreeColorado.description: Hunger Free Colorado provides food resources to individuals and families in need.

coloradoDivisionofVeteransAffairs.name: Colorado Division of Veterans Affairs (CDVA)
coloradoDivisionofVeteransAffairs.description: Offering free assistance to veterans and their family members, with claims, applications, and appeals to the VA.
coloradoDivisionofVeteransAffairs.location: Bill Daniels Veteran Service Center 1247 Santa Fe Denver, CO 80204

coloradoLegalServices.name: Colorado Legal Services
coloradoLegalServices.description: Provides legal support in family law cases such as divorce, custody, child support, domestic abuse, as well as wills, probate, power of attorney, housing, public benefit, foreclosure, consumer, and tax related issues.

disabilityLawColorado.name: Disability Law Colorado
disabilityLawColorado.description: Protection & Advocacy System for Colorado. We work to protect disability rights and improve the human, civil, and legal rights of Coloradans through legal representation, advocacy, and education.

denverIRCVitaProgram.name: Denver IRC Vita Program
denverIRCVitaProgram.description: Offers Free tax assistance to individuals who earn less than $60,000 annually. Preparers are free, trained and certified by the Internal Revenue Service (IRS) and will help you claim all available tax credits.
denverIRCVitaProgram.location: ICR Denver 1873 S. Bellaire St., Suite 500, Denver, Co. 80222

legalAidFoundationOfColorado.name: Legal Aid Foundation of Colorado
legalAidFoundationOfColorado.description: Colorado’s statewide Legal Aid program. CLS is the only agency in the state that provides free legal services in civil cases to clients who could not otherwise afford them in every Colorado county through a network of 13 offices.

advocatesForRecovery.name: Advocates for Recovery
advocatesForRecovery.description: Offers support and services to individuals and family members suffering from active addiction, as well as the growing pains of early recovery.

stoutStreetFoundation.name: Stout Street Foundation
stoutStreetFoundation.description: The Stout Street Foundation provides addiction and recovery resources to individuals and families in need.

treatmentLocator.name: Treatment Locator
treatmentLocator.description: Find various treatment options for substance abuse and mental health.

coloradoCoalitionAgainstSexualAssault.name: Colorado Coalition Against Sexual Assault
coloradoCoalitionAgainstSexualAssault.description: The collective voice of rape crisis advocates across the state of Colorado.
coloradoCoalitionAgainstSexualAssault.location: 1330 Fox Street, Suite 2 PO Box 40350 Denver, CO 80204

crisisSupportSuicideAndCrisisLifeline.name: Crisis Support Suicide and Crisis Lifeline
crisisSupportSuicideAndCrisisLifeline.description: Provides 24/7, free and confidential support for people in distress, prevention and crisis resources for you or your loved ones, and best practices for professionals in the United States.

mileHighBehavioralHealthcare.name: Mile High Behavioral Healthcare
mileHighBehavioralHealthcare.description: Offers individuals and families recovery from trauma and substance use, mental health challenges, homelessness, woman & families, LGBTQ/Transgender support.

paragonBehavioralHealthConnections.name: Paragon Behavioral Health Connections
paragonBehavioralHealthConnections.description: Offers telehealth services and in-home support to individuals and families. Common topics include depression, substance use, grief and loss, self-injury, suicidal thoughts, bullying, stress, parenting concerns, trauma, drugs and alcohol, relationship problems, family crisis, anxiety, domestic violence, disability, concerns for a friend or family member and resource questions. Accepts Medicaid and offers free screening services.

peopleHouse.name: People House
peopleHouse.description: Affordable counseling providing holistic mental health therapy and a variety of resources such as psychology, marriage, and family therapy. Therapy is offered on a sliding fee scale.

wellpower.name: Wellpower
wellpower.description: Offers telehealth services and in-home support to individuals and families. Common topics include depression, substance use, grief and loss, self-injury, suicidal thoughts, bullying, stress, parenting concerns, trauma, drugs and alcohol, relationship problems, family crisis, anxiety, domestic violence, disability, concerns for a friend or family member and resource questions. Accepts Medicaid and offers free screening services.

coloradoDentalAssociation.name: Colorado Dental Association
coloradoDentalAssociation.description: Offers dental care on a sliding fee scale to individuals who are unable to afford treatment. Several of these organizations have financial and residency requirements. Others are established to help a certain portion of the population (i.e. children, the homeless, people with disabilities, etc.).
coloradoDentalAssociation.location: 8301 East Prentice Avenue Suite 400 Greenwood Village CO 80111

coloradoMissionofMercy.name: Colorado Mission of Mercy
coloradoMissionofMercy.description: Offers a list of dental clinics and health centers throughout the state. Most of these organizations offer dental care on a sliding fee scale based on your financial situation. It is best to contact these clinics directly as some of them have specific qualifying requirements or residency restrictions.

martinezMobileDentalClinic.name: Martinez Mobile Dental Clinic
martinezMobileDentalClinic.description: Offers a list of dental clinics and health centers throughout the state. Most of these organizations offer dental care on a sliding fee scale based on your financial situation. It is best to contact these clinics directly as some of them have specific qualifying requirements or residency restrictions.

metroDenverDentalSociety.name: Metro Denver Dental Society
metroDenverDentalSociety.description: Low-income dental resources for children, seniors, Native Americans, homeless, AIDS/HIV patients, veterans, persons with disabilities, orthodontic treatment.

autismSocietyOfColorado.name: Autism Society of Colorado
autismSocietyOfColorado.description: Connecting connect people with Autism to the resources they need to live full, vibrant, self-actualized lives.

alliance.name: Alliance
alliance.description: A nonprofit, statewide association comprised of Intellectual and Developmental Disability (IDD) case management and provider agencies, businesses serving the IDD community, and disability advocacy organizations.
alliance.location: 1410 Grant Street Suite B-305 Denver, Colorado, 80203

developmentalDisabilitiesResourceCenter.name: Developmental Disabilities Resource Center
developmentalDisabilitiesResourceCenter.description: Opportunities for People with Intellectual and Developmental Disabilities and their Families to Participate Fully in the Community. Services include: coordination of services, early intervention, family support, adult day services and employment services, therapeutic learning and behaviorla health services.

eastersealsColorado.name: Easterseals Colorado
eastersealsColorado.description: Creating a future where people with disabilities, their families, and caregivers all have the opportunity to thrive and fully participate in our communities.
eastersealsColorado.location: 393 S. Harlan St. Suite 250 Lakewood, CO 80226

parentToParentOfColorado.name: Parent to Parent of Colorado
parentToParentOfColorado.description: Connecting families of sons and daughters with disabilities or special healthcare needs to emotional and informational supports.

theAutismCommunityCenter.name: The Autism Community Center
theAutismCommunityCenter.description: Providing a safe, supportive, and welcoming environment for individuals and families affected by Autism Spectrum Disorder.

adultProtectiveServices.name: Adult Protective Services
adultProtectiveServices.description: Adult Protective Services (APS) provides vulnerable adults protection from abuse, neglect or exploitation and offers services.

coloradoChildAbuseAndNeglectHotline.name: Colorado Child Abuse and Neglect Hotline
coloradoChildAbuseAndNeglectHotline.description: The Colorado Child Abuse and Neglect Hotline is a toll-free hotline for reporting suspected child abuse and neglect.

hungerFreeHotline.name: Hunger Free Hotline
hungerFreeHotline.description: The Hunger Free Hotline provides information on food resources and assistance programs.

nationalDomesticViolenceHotline.name: National Domestic Violence Hotline
nationalDomesticViolenceHotline.description: The National Domestic Violence Hotline provides support and resources to individuals experiencing domestic violence.

nationalSexualAssaultHotline.name: National Sexual Assault Hotline
nationalSexualAssaultHotline.description: The National Sexual Assault Hotline provides support and resources to individuals experiencing sexual assault.

nationalSuicideAndPreventionHotline.name: National Suicide And Prevention Hotline
nationalSuicideAndPreventionHotline.description: The National Suicide Prevention Lifeline offers services to talk to a skilled counselor.

theGayLesbianBisexualAndTransgenderNatio.name: The Gay, Lesbian, Bisexual, and Transgender National Hotline
theGayLesbianBisexualAndTransgenderNatio.description: The Gay, Lesbian, Bisexual and Transgender National Hotline provide telephone and email peer-counseling, as well as factual information and local resources for cities and towns across the United States. All services are free and confidential.

rapeAbuseAndIncestNationalNetwork.name: Rape Abuse And Incest National Network
rapeAbuseAndIncestNationalNetwork.description: RAINN (Rape, Abuse & Incest National Network) is the nation's largest anti-sexual violence organization. RAINN created and operates the National Sexual Assault Hotline in partnership with more than 1,000 local sexual assault service providers across the country and operates the DoD Safe Helpline for the Department of Defense. RAINN also carries out programs to prevent sexual violence, help survivors, and ensure that perpetrators are brought to justice.
